msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 36 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4567; Text: Q 7:81-Q 12:18; 13 lines per page; Dimensions: 375 x 270 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 3rd (9th) century [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 18: "50 Y. 4567 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 270mm boy ve 375mm eninde cönk şeklinde 36 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yaziyle 290mm uzunl.[uğunda] 13 satır. Tahminen III. (IX) asırda yazılmıştır. Üzerine sonradan talikle yazılmış Hazreti Os̠mān hattiyle diye yazılmıştır. Sure başları ve duraklar müzehhep. Kırmızı noktalarla harekelidir. Şemseli kahve rengi deri cilt. Bu cilt Aʿrāf (7) surenin 81. ayetinin ortasında başlar ve Yūsuf (12) surenin 18. ayetine kadar devam eder."

This can be translated as follows: "50 Y. 4567 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 36 junk shaped leaves of 270 mm height and 375 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 13 lines measuring 290 mm. Probably copied during the 3rd (9th) century. [The phare] “in the ʿUthmānic way of writing” was written later onto it, in taʿlīq. Sūra beginnings and verse separators are decorated. Vowel marked with red dots. Brown leather binding with mandorla (şemse). The fragment begins with Q 7:81 (Sūra al-ʾAʿrāf) and continues until Q 12:18 (Sūra Yūsuf)."
